title: Technical Lead Manager, Sensor Integration
description:
**About**



With customers at its core, Stack AV is focused on revolutionizing the way businesses transport goods, designing solutions to alleviate long-standing issues that have plagued the trucking industry including driver shortages, lagging efficiency in uptime per vehicle, overarching safety concerns, high operating costs, and elevated emission levels. By building safe and efficient autonomous trucking solutions, Stack AV is creating better and smarter supply chains for its partners, improving business outcomes for its customers, delivering goods to end-users faster, and ultimately moving the trucking industry forward.

**What We're Looking for:**



We are looking for people who are passionate about delivering self-driving (L4) products that make the way we move safer, faster, and more efficient. We seek mission-driven, highly skilled people with deep experience in fast-paced, rapidly growing, tech development environments.


**Team Description:**



We are a team of passionate experts in autonomy, robotics, AI, machine learning, large scale compute, electronics design, systems design, electrical engineering, and mechanical engineering who have a deep desire to see self-driving products make the way we move safer, faster, and more efficient.



We offer flexible work locations and premier health benefits, and an opportunity to work alongside industry veterans from the autonomous vehicle industry.



We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We believe that diverse teams produce the best ideas and outcomes. We are committed to building a culture of inclusion, entrepreneurship, and innovation across gender, race, age, sexual orientation, religion, disability, and identity.


**What You'll Do / Responsibilities:**


* Build, lead and manage an efficient engineering team to tackle challenges directly related to development, testing and validation of vehicle integration systems for autonomous vehicles.
* Work directly with suppliers and OEM partners on design and development of vehicle sets.
* Design mechanical solutions to integrate sensors and computers into autonomous vehicles.
* Develop innovative solutions for sensor cleaning and cooling in autonomous vehicles.
* Test and validate designs for use on vehicles.
* Evaluate supplier component designs, specify requirements, and test plans.
* Take technical ownership of hardware delivery through the full development cycle.
* Work cross functionally with a team of stakeholders to define requirements, architecture and system design.
* Present mechanical solutions to cross functional teams.
* Architect and greenfield novel solutions for mechanical and electronic integration into vehicles.
* Perform sensor field of view analysis, and static / dynamic tolerance simulations.
* Travel required to visit vehicle bring-up and test facilities for hardware debug and initial integration as well as to visit the facilities of suppliers, manufacturers, and OEM partners.


**Experience / Necessary Qualifications:**


* Degree in Mechanical Engineering, Mechatronics or a related field.
* Experience leading engineering teams.
* Experience working through an entire product development cycle of hardware design.
* Familiarity with a broad range of manufacturing processes.
* 10+ years of relevant experience.


**Nice To Haves:**


* "You have shipped a product."
* Familiarity with Autonomous vehicle sensors (Radar / Camera / Lidar) and their integration.
* Experience with automotive EV / DV / PV cycles.

 *We are proud to be an equal-opportunity workplace. We believe that diverse teams produce the best ideas and outcomes. We are committed to building a culture of inclusion, entrepreneurship, and innovation across gender, race, age, sexual orientation, religion, disability, and identity.*


**Please Note:** Pursuant to its business activities and use of technology, Stack AV complies with all applicable U.S. national security laws, regulations, and administrative requirements, which can restrict Stack AV's ability to employ certain persons in certain positions pursuant to a range of national security-related requirements. As such, this position may be contingent upon Stack AV verifying a candidate's residence, U.S. person status, and/or citizenship status. This position may also involve working with software and technologies subject to U.S. export control regulations. Under these regulations, it may be necessary for Stack AV to obtain a U.S. government export license prior to releasing its technologies to certain persons. If Stack AV determines that a candidate's residence, U.S. person status, and/or citizenship status will require a license, prohibit the candidate from working in this position, or otherwise be subject to national security-related restrictions, Stack AV expressly reserves the right to either consider the candidate for a different position that is not subject to such restrictions, on whatever terms and conditions Stack AV shall establish in its sole discretion, or, in the alternative, decline to move forward with the candidate's application.

title: Help Desk Manager | Work From Home
description:
ClinicMind is a leading provider of comprehensive EHR Software and RCM services in the Healthcare industry. ClinicMind’s ONC-certified software solution includes a multi-specialty EHR Platform as a Service (PaaS), practice management software, mobile EHR, a patient portal, and dozens of integrated applications for Patient Relationship Management, Clinical Compliance, Patient Education, Credit Card processing, and other specialty EHRs. ClinicMind’s software-enabled RCM services include full-service multi-specialty medical billing, credentialing, medical coding, and prior authorization services. We seek an organized and self-motivated Help Desk Manager to drive our Value Added Reseller (VAR) Incubator. The VAR Incubator Help Desk Manager reports to the VAR Incubator Manager.

  


### **Responsibilities**



* Interact with ClinicMind VARs


* Train their Customer Support and RCM teams to use the ClinicMind system


* Help our VARs build their own branded Help Desk teams


* Train their Help Desks to Troubleshoot user problems


* Train their Help Desks to figure out the objectives of the users’ actions and their obstacles


* Work together with our software support to solve VAR operations problems


* Provide 2nd level support to the VARs


* Manage and Build a shared Help Desk knowledge base


* Create short user training videos and training presentations


* Document problem solutions


* Build and implement multi-choice tests
  


**Qualifications**



* Commitment to ClinicMind Core Values


* Outstanding teamwork, positive "Can-Do" attitude


* Patience in asking questions to understand the root cause of the problems


* Empathetic to customer needs


* Excellent problem-solving skills


* At least three years experience in client support of Electronic Healthcare Record (EHR) software and/or Medical Billing service, preferably on the Help Desk


* Excellent verbal and written communication in English


* College degree or equivalent (College education in science, technology, engineering, or mathematics (STEM) is a plus)


* The following is a plus


* Good performance on a ClinicMind Help Desk, CRM, RCM, or SWAT teams


* Experience with ClinicMind or Vericle or Genesis Chiropractic software


* Billing using ClinicMind or Vericle software


* Adequate scores at the ClinicMind Team Leadership Training Program


* BPO management for Billing using ClinicMind or Vericle software


* Prior employment at ClinicMind, Indicle, Vericle Pacific, Billing Precision, or eSpoc
  


**NOTE**


* Must have a stable internet connection minimum of 5 MBPS
* Must be comfortable working the US business hours
* Must own a laptop with at least 8 GB of memory

title: IT Manager
description:
Enterprise Mobility is the world’s largest car rental operator and an industry leader in mobility and technology. We’re one of the top global travel companies, ranking ahead of many airlines and most cruise lines and hotels. And no matter what transportation challenges our customers face, we have an innovative solution.  

We operate the Enterprise Rent-A-Car National Car Rental and Alamo Rent A Car brands via more than 10,000 fully staffed neighborhood and airport offices, including franchisee branches, in over 90 countries and territories.  

Through this robust global network, we operate a fleet of over 2.3 million vehicles and provide a comprehensive portfolio of transportation solutions, including car rental, carsharing, vanpooling, car sales, truck rental, vehicle-subscription and affiliated fleet management services. As a total mobility provider, we serve the needs of a wide variety of customers, businesses, government agencies and organizations every day.  

At the center of it all, our dedicated IT teams innovate, design and develop the technology that is redefining how customers rent, buy and share vehicles from our family of brands. Here, you will be part of a diverse and talented team that creates and delivers powerful technology solutions for our customers and employees across the world with the resources and support to develop in a variety of career paths.  

As an Enterprise Mobility employee, we offer an excellent package with market-competitive pay, comprehensive healthcare packages, 401k matching & profit sharing, schedule flexibility, work from home opportunities, paid time off, and organizational growth potential.  

This position is open to candidates who wish to work from home (WFH). Employees who choose virtual / remote work should have an adequate space to serve as their home office. #LI-REMOTE **Responsibilities:**  

As part of the Network Platforms team, you will lead a team of engineers responsible for maintaining various network tools and providing overall guidance/ supervision. You will ensure all members of assigned technical teams are effective, fully utilized and provide leadership in key interactions with others to define, analyze, and deliver solutions. You will be responsible for building trust to influence peers and others to break down barriers and drive results. Here, you’ll have the opportunity to work across multiple teams to help deliver innovative solutions in support of Enterprise Mobility's technology strategy. You will need to collaborate with leaders and teams throughout IT to ensure alignment and partnership.

  



As a **Manager** with Enterprise Mobility, you will be responsible for defining the goals, objectives, processes, and resources to support the overall team needs that align with the business goals. This is an ideal role for a leader looking to make a significant impact, develop and grow in a team-oriented environment. You’ll have the opportunity to work with senior leaders in the organization, so collaboration and influence skills are key.

 **Key Areas of Responsibilities**

* Lead a high-performing team with a focus on agility and continuous improvement.
* Identify, influence, and drive opportunities to further our business objectives.
* Own and drive multiple simultaneous efforts and roadmaps within the area through close coordination with various IT teams and external vendors.
* Report performance and cost KPIs/metrics related to our varying platforms to senior leadership.
* Collaborate with leaders and teams throughout IT to ensure alignment and partnership.
* Provide leadership in key interactions with others to define, analyze, and deliver customer solutions.
* Build trust to influence peers and others to break down barriers and drive results.
* Provide escalation for operational teams as a last tier of support for the business.
* Provide overall expertise with all Network Tools functions.
* Maintain and monitor required staffing levels and schedule to ensure that the team can meet the demand of the business needs.
* Hire, develop, and retain highly responsive and customer focused engineers to ensure the effective operation of the business.
* Manage tools, systems, and procedures to ensure dynamic management of product set.
* Interface with key partners, suppliers, and procurement teams to layout strategic direction, incorporate into functional roadmaps and cost-effective solutions, and contribute to contract and commercial reviews.
* Ensure continual process improvement within the environment, including but not limited to automation of tasks and reporting, implementation of enterprise-wide monitoring initiatives, and routine administration tasks.

 *Equal Opportunity Employer/Disability/Veterans* **Qualifications:** **Required:*** Must be presently authorized to work in the U.S. without a requirement for work authorization sponsorship by our company for this position now or in the future
* The IT Manager position typically requires 6+ years of related experience
* 2+ years of people management experience, to include hiring, 1-1 meetings, career coaching/ mentoring, performance reviews, salary reviews, etc.
* Experience working in a large technology/ network environment
* Adept at improving outcomes through proactive coaching and development at all levels
* Prior experience and knowledge of network technologies that support LAN/WAN, data center and cloud networking
* Prior experience and knowledge of networking protocols such as TCP/IP and SNMP/ RMON
* Must have displayed leadership and team centric skills and strong solution orientation
* Must demonstrate outstanding relationship management skills with the ability to position yourself as a trusted partner while being a champion for change and conflict resolution
* Outstanding communication skills are required, with the ability to effectively defend ideas and solutions; convey complex information regarding risk and security issues in a manner that is easily understood and actionable.
* Must be committed to incorporating security into all decisions and daily job responsibilities

**Preferred:*** Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Information Systems, Management Information Systems, or related field preferred
* Experience with some or all of the following technologies is preferred:
	+ Gigamon
	+ F5 Systems
	+ Infoblox NetMRI
	+ NetScout
	+ Network Insights
	+ Aruba ClearPass
* Ability to challenge current solutions, determine appropriate solutions, and ensure there is alignment across the organization

title: Wealth (Retirement) IT Director
description:
*Together we fight for everyone’s opportunity for a better financial future.*
We will do this together — with customers, partners and colleagues. We will fight for others, not against: We will stand up for and champion everyone’s access to opportunities. The status quo is not good enough … we believe every individual and every community deserves access to financial opportunities. We are determined to support both individuals and communities in reaching a better financial future. We know that reaching this future depends on our actions today.
Like our Purpose Statement, Voya believes in being bold and committed to action. We are committed to a work environment where the differences that we are born with — and those we acquire throughout our lives — are understood, valued and intentionally pursued. We believe that our employees own our culture and have a responsibility to foster an environment where we all feel comfortable bringing our whole selves to work. Purposefully bringing our differences together to positively influence our culture, serve our clients and enrich our communities is essential to our vision.
Are you ready to join a company with a strong purpose and a winning culture? Start your Voyage – Apply Now
Get to Know the Opportunity:
Voya Wealth business is looking to find a manager of IT professionals that will lead a small cross functional team that will include delivery managers, business analysts, developers, and QA analysts. The manager will lead managers and senior individual contributors and be directly responsible for results produced by the team/group/sub-unit managed. The team will also consist of some offshore IT resources.
The Contributions You'll Make:* You will supervise IT project teams and/or service units with specialists to ensure results meet customer expectations and adhere to internal IT standards, methodologies, and strategies.
* You will troubleshoot special problems and lead performance improvement efforts based on a solid understanding of the technical concepts, methods, and practices applied by reporting staff.
* You will collaborates with team, IT colleagues, IT leadership, business colleagues, senior business leaders and occasionally external clients to identify customer requirements, assess impacts to other data, systems, products or services, compare costs and benefits, consider available technologies and processes and recommends solutions.
* This role includes monitoring and reporting to IT management and user/customer management the status of multiple, concurrent project and/or service efforts.
* You will develop and manage business plan(s) and budget(s) for functional area; identifies resource needs and develops supporting justifications for them; responsible for the overall success unit managed.
* Your ability to delivery on large programs with multiple work streams using strong project management skills will be required
* Your will monitor IT project financials and IT resource demand and capacity
* You will present to leadership at steering and advisory-level meetings
* Experience interacting and communicating status to external clients


Minimum Knowledge & Experience:* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Finance or a directly related field
* Ten years of progressively responsible experience in IT in an applications development environment
* Demonstrated success in project management and execution with involvement in multiple major projects or a sustained record of success delivering complex IT services to a diverse clientele.


Minimum Knowledge & Experience:* Financial Services experience
* Experience or knowledge of Retirement systems
* Knowledge of OMNI software


#LI-BP2
#LI-Remote

Voya is committed to pay that’s fair and equitable, which means comparable pay for comparable roles and responsibilities.

Actual compensation offered may vary from the posted salary range based upon the candidate’s geographic location, work experience, education, licensure requirements and/or skill level and will be finalized at the time of offer. Salaries for part-time roles will be prorated based upon the agreed upon number of hours to be regularly worked.
$145,470 - $192,590 USD
Be Well. Stay Well.
Voya provides the resources that can make a difference in your lives. To us, this means thriving physically, financially, socially and emotionally. Voya benefits are designed to help you do just that. That’s why we offer an array of plans, programs, tools and resources with one goal in mind: To help you and your family be well and stay well.
What We Offer* Health, dental, vision and life insurance plans
* 401(k) Savings plan – with generous company matching contributions (up to 6%)
* Voya Retirement Plan – employer paid cash balance retirement plan (4%)
* Tuition reimbursement up to $5,250/year
* Paid time off – including 20 days paid time off, nine paid company holidays and a flexible Diversity Celebration Day.
* Paid volunteer time — 40 hours per calendar year

  

Critical Skills
At Voya, we have identified the following critical skills which are key to success in our culture:* Customer Focused: Passionate drive to delight our customers and offer unique solutions that deliver on their expectations.
* Critical Thinking: Thoughtful process of analyzing data and problem solving data to reach a well-reasoned solution.
* Team Mentality: Partnering effectively to drive our culture and execute on our common goals.
* Business Acumen: Appreciation and understanding of the financial services industry in order to make sound business decisions.
* Learning Agility: Openness to new ways of thinking and acquiring new skills to retain a competitive advantage.

  

Equal Employment Opportunity*Voya Financial is an equal-opportunity employer. Voya Financial provides equal opportunity to qualified individuals regardless of race, color, sex, national origin, citizenship status, religion, age, disability, veteran status, creed, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, or any other status protected by state or local law.*

title: Manager, IT Financial Systems & Strategy
description:
Company:Driven Brands
We invite you to join us at Driven Brands!


Headquartered in Charlotte, NC, Driven Brands (NASDAQ: DRVN) is the largest automotive services company in North America, providing a range of consumer and commercial automotive needs, including paint, collision, glass, vehicle repair, oil change, maintenance and car wash.


With over 4,500 centers in 15 countries, Driven Brands is the parent company of some of North America’s leading automotive service brands including Take 5 Oil Change, Take 5 Car Wash, Driven Glass, Meineke, Maaco, CARSTAR, and more. Our network services over 50 million vehicles annually and generates more than $5 billion in system-wide sales each year.


Our culture inspires high performance and innovation, enabling our employees to go further, faster in their careers. With amazing people and great brands, we confidently look forward to exciting growth ahead, and believe in following the values that support this vision.


**JOB DESCRIPTION:**

**Responsibilities**

* Leverages finance process and technology best practices; partnering with both finance organizations as well as various corporate functions (HR, Procurement, Legal) to support and improve existing business processes
* Drives simplification and standardization strategies across brands
* Works to elicit high-level requirements and capture business needs through dialogue with business partners and key stakeholders
* Supports applications and solutions delivery by participating in design reviews and walk-throughs to communicate requirements and validate proposed solutions
* Leads and builds a brand new team of business analysts supporting the finance organizations with Oracle Cloud ERP & EPM
* Performs impact analysis and supports application testing, implementation, and training activities throughout the process
* Collaborates with corporate finance teams to provide ad hoc support on complex subjects and analytic projects to support strategic initiatives
* Supports Finance ERP related business process/activities in existing legacy environment and throughout the implementation and post implementation of Oracle Cloud ERP & EPM
* Partners with other IT areas to identify data needs and appropriate data sources to utilize while remaining compliant
* Identifies data quality issues and works to resolve through best practice strategies
* Understands data integrations to ensure efficient data exchange across systems
* Works collaboratively with various IT teams to design and deliver optimized, user- friendly reporting solutions as well as cost effective historical data archiving solutions

**Qualifications & Experience**

* Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Accounting or Finance
* 7-10+ years of experience with increasing responsibility in an IT or business related financial role
* Must possess expert knowledge of accounting principles, financial processes and controls
* ERP Financial Module experience (GL, FA, Projects. etc) required, Oracle Cloud ERP and/or EPM preferred
* Experience in leveraging technology to improve finance processes
* Process-oriented with the ability to structure processes and related data across brands and countries
* Experience in defining, scoping, and managing process and technology initiatives
* Ability to gather, structure and analyze data from multiple data sources
* Strong understanding of advanced data analysis tools and querying languages (SQL)
* Must possess technical and data modelling aptitude
* Ability to communicate/present to management
* Ability to play both a strategic and tactical role as a leader and demonstrate an ownership mentality
* Strong initiative-taker with a resilient, solution minded approach to complex problems
* Ability to partners with others to simplify complex processes, break down barriers and incorporate the ideas of others
* Demonstrated experience in the software development lifecycle
* Intellectual curiosity to understand business trends
* Ability to manage priorities against multiple deadlines in a challenging environment


#LI-KD1


#LI-REMOTE


DBCORP

Florida

$92,700.00 - $176,900.00

title: IT Sourcing Manager III
description:
**Posted Date:** Feb 9, 2024  

**Employment Type:** Full Time

**Pay Range:**


(Minimum to mid pay range specific to NY, CA, CO, WA)


82,200.00 - 102,800.00 USD Annual
Brinks Texas License #C00550


#LI-Remote


The Brink’s name is a promise to respect the trust we’ve earned in over 150 years in business. Every employee honors that promise by offering the highest levels of service and support to our customers. We take pride in our work, and we share a passion about our future. Learn why so many people have made the choice to join our team – and stay here.

**Job Title**


IT Sourcing Manager III**Job Description**


Brink’s is a premier provider of armored car transportation, currency and coin processing, ATM servicing and other value added services to financial institutions, retailers and other commercial and government entities. The company has a proud history of providing growth and advancement opportunities for its employees. We have a challenging opportunity for a **Strategic Sourcing Manager III.**

**Job Summary:**


The position of Strategic Sourcing Manager 3 will lead medium to high value local, country or multi-country level sourcing projects, activities & contract negotiations for various service categories that may include professional services, IT, facilities, financial services, travel and other indirect requirements. This role will primarily be responsible for conducting strategic sourcing events and negotiating acceptable terms and conditions with Suppliers according to Brink’s approved processes and to mitigate risk to Brink’s satisfaction. The candidate will perform data analytics and work collaboratively with stakeholders and other Strategic Sourcing team members to meet stakeholder supply market requirements, create value, ensure process compliance and drive negotiated cost savings and avoidances. Candidate should have experience in contract management, strategic sourcing, supplier and stakeholder relationship management. This position collaborates with Strategic Sourcing, Finance, Legal, and various operational departments to advance the company's strategic sourcing processes and strengthen our supply market solutions to meet company goals.


.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Perform data analytics to identify opportunities to drive value through improved supply market solutions.
* Develop, communicate and execute category sourcing strategies at a local, regional or global level.
* Plan and execute strategic sourcing events according to Brink’s Strategic Sourcing Processes. Track and report annualized savings according to Brink’s Strategic Sourcing policies and procedures. .
* Provide Strategic Sourcing project leadership and support to achieve assigned Regional, and Country operations initiatives and savings targets
* Track and report progress against assigned strategic sourcing and specific country cost savings initiatives. Provide support and updates to Strategic Sourcing and operational leadership on emerging opportunities/risks.
* Partner with suppliers to establish volume agreements that take advantage of economies of scale and leverage Brink’s spend on a local / regional level.
* Work collaboratively with stakeholders, business partners, operational leaders, and the Strategic Sourcing team to resolve problems with contract interpretation and vendor performance measurement
* Ensure that required reporting, accounting, contractual, and legal standards are maintained.
* Special projects and other associated duties to support the global Strategic Sourcing organization, as assigned

**Minimum Qualifications:**

* Minimum of 3 to 8 years’ indirect strategic sourcing experience in a large, multi-country company environment.
* Minimum of 3 to 8 years’ experience negotiating contract terms of medium to high complexity and pricing in a high spend multi-country environment.
* Minimum of 3 to 8 years’ experience utilizing spend analytics to identify strategic sourcing opportunities.
* Mid / senior level stakeholder relationship management experience.
* Experience in indirect category strategy development and execution in a high spend multi-country environment.
* Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Supply Chain, Finance, Business Administration or related field or equivalent experience.
* MBA a plus.

**Professional Skills:**

* Strong consultative, analytical and problem solving skills
* Excellent interpersonal/communication and presentation skills at all organizational levels.
* Demonstrated ability to multi-task
* Detail oriented, strong organizational skills and ability to work independently

**About Brink’s**
-----------------


Brink’s is the global leader in security and logistics services, trusted by banks, financial institutions and businesses in both public and private sectors. We deliver the currency of the world to businesses in our communities. We do it because we’re needed. We do it because we’re trusted and valued. We do it because it makes us proud. Brink’s Proud.

--------------------

Upon completion of the application process, you will receive an email confirming that we have received your application. We will review all candidates and notify you of your status should we deem you fit for a job. title: IT Security Manager - remote (IL preferred)
description:
BrightStar Care is the nation’s leading home care and medical staffing franchisor, and we are continuing to grow! We have an opportunity for an experienced IT Security Manager on our team.The IT Security Manager’s role is responsible for identifying, assessing, and managing cyber threats and risk to BrightStar Care’s data and systems both in the cloud and on-premises. The IT Security Manager will also maintain HIPAA compliance as the Security Officer and implement compliant frameworks for HIPAA such as NIST and HITRUST. This position is hands-on and will analyze and ensure applications and systems are secure, conduct 3rd party reviews and audits, define, and execute proper policies, and manage the overall cyber security posture of the organization. The IT Security Manager ensures that when attacks and suspected compromises happen, these incidents are dealt with promptly and effectively to minimize recurrences. This position requires technical ability and is a hands-on role in a Windows-based local environment with a growing Azure/ O365 presence.

 **Responsibilities:**

* HIPAA Security Officer for the organization.
* Conduct security risk assessments and create mitigation plans.
* Roadmap and manage projects supporting threat and vulnerability management, security risks, cyber risks, and proper access rights/authentication.
* Design, coordinate, and oversee security testing procedures to verify controls for systems, networks, applications, and remediation activities of any identified risks.
* Design and implement technical controls to support and enforce defined security policies.
* Document and update security controls, recovery plans, prepare detailed system security plans, and risk assessments.
* Work directly with external and internal partners to conduct audits, assessments, and penetration tests.
* Perform regular system scans to identify vulnerabilities and work with BTG /vendors to mitigate vulnerabilities.
* Actively monitor SIEM, logs, AV/EDR platforms, to identify and respond to threats and vulnerabilities.
* Work with BTG technology teams to secure O365/ Azure and on-premises environments.
* Support BTG in the incident response process to minimize impact and quickly deliver resolution and communication.
* Manage production issues and incidents and participate in problem and change management.
* Evaluate, update, and track employee security awareness programs are maintained with participation.
* Ensure all data assets are inventoried and secured in a risk-appropriate manner.
* Build, update, and delivery a quarterly security review driven from data and risk probabilities
* Other duties as assigned.

 **Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience required.
* A minimum of 3 years of applicable experience required.
* Previous experience in security management and compliance in HIPAA environment.
* Previous experience implementing frameworks such as NIST / ISO / HITRUST.
* CISSP, CISA, CRISC, CISM, CGEIT, ISA or other industry certifications desired.
* Knowledge of information security principles and practices, general procedures, and guidelines.
* Experience participating in projects helping to design strategies, drive solutions, and document results.
* Experience with third-party system integrations in a Microsoft Windows environment.
* Knowledge and experience with Windows client/ server and network technology such as Meraki MX firewalls.
* Experience with Azure / O365 security and compliance.
* Experience with SIEM tools.
* Experience with AV and EDR tools.
* Experience managing third-party security vendors.
* Excellent communication, collaboration, team building, and relationship management skills required.
* Must be able to collaborate with other IT disciplines and business stakeholders for the creation and evaluation of business cases, success criteria, requirements, schedules, quality assurance, training, and communication plans.
* Must use Microsoft Office and Windows computers.

 **Here are some of the perks:**

* Medical benefits
* 401k with matching funds
* Paid time off
* Flexible scheduling
* Growth opportunities


Candidate must have demonstrated alignment and experience in successfully living the **BrightStar Care Core Values**:

* **Be Open and Honest:** Approachable, Fun, Unflappable, Kind, Empathetic
* **Serve with Passion:** Help First, Confident Yet Humble, For the Greater Good, Make a Real Difference
* **Do the Right Thing:** Honest, Ethical, Tell the Truth
* **Do What You Say:** On Time, Finish What You Start, Accountable, Take Responsibility
* **Make it Great:** Continuous Improvement, Exceed Expectations, Bring Out the Best in Others, Detail Oriented

  

Equal Opportunity Employer


BrightStar Care is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and is committed to maintaining a diverse and inclusive work environment. All qualified applicants will receive considerations for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, disability, marital status, familial status, sexual orientation, pregnancy, genetic information, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, veteran status, and any other legally protected status under federal, state, or local anti-discrimination laws. BrightStar Care participates in E-Verify.


Disability Accommodation


For individuals with disabilities that need additional assistance at any point in the application and interview process, please email BrightStarHR@brightstarcare. com.

title: IT Operations Manager Energy - Remote
description:
**Why join us?**


It’s an exciting time at AtkinsRéalis! We are rapidly growing in the US. Our company purpose is to build a better world for our planet and its people. We recognize the importance of making sure that our clients and employees, feel this purpose every day. AtkinsRéalis is proud of our company culture that promotes, diversity, equity and inclusion. Our company ethos include collaboration through the connection of people, data and technology. We are a global firm, who leverages having employees located throughout the world, creating valuable partnerships and doing our part to make this planet and its people, thrive. We need energetic, passionate and eager professionals like you to join our team. There has never been a better time to be a part of AtkinsRéalis!


We are seeking an **IT Operations Manager Energy – Remote.****This remote position is based out of our Oak Ridge, TN office.**

**About Us**


AtkinsRéalis is one of the world’s most respected design, engineering and project management consultancies. AtkinsRéalis has been providing infrastructure planning, engineering, construction, environmental consulting, urban planning, architecture, and program management services to public and private clients across the United States for more than 50 years. AtkinsRéalis has the depth and breadth of expertise to respond to the most technically challenging and time-critical infrastructure projects and the urgent transition to a low-carbon economy.

**How will you contribute to the team?**

* Monitors Team performance and implement processes to ensure availability, reliability, and efficiency across the IT Organization.
* Collaborates with Cyber Security to establish effective security protocols and implement policies and processes while considering the CIA Triad (Confidentiality, Integrity, and Availability) design principles.
* Assists with maturing the organization’s Information Security Operations and participate in the execution of related projects.
* Manages multiple projects and deadlines with strict attention to detail and prioritization.
* Builds effective relationships and partnership with vendors, suppliers, and other external parties.
* Stays up to date with the latest technologies and IT trends.
* Identifies emerging cyber security threats and recommend actions to mitigate risk.
* Effectively communicates and collaborates with Company Divisions, Departments and Business Leadership.
* Assists with development of business continuity and disaster recovery plans and execution of plans.
* Participates in Risk Evaluations and approve change requests as part of the change management process.
* Participates in annual Budgeting activities.
* Mentors and trains team members and help them reach their full potential.
* Performs other duties as assigned.

**What will you contribute?**

* Bachelor's degree required in computer science or related technical discipline.
* Minimum 10 years of IT experience in a mid to large size enterprise environment.
* Minimum of 5 years of experience in IT operations management.
* Must be able to implement the systems, tools and applications required for efficient operations of a corporate network/infrastructure.
* Project management skills with PMI or PMP training and certification desired.
* Proven experience in developing and implementing IT initiatives.
* Excellent problem-solving skills.
* Ability to obtain and maintain a DOE "Q" personnel security clearance.
* Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP) certification.
* Knowledge of NIST standards including Special Publication 800-171.
* Must be a U.S. citizen in order to be considered.

**What we offer at AtkinsRéalis:**


AtkinsRéalis realizes that health, mental and financial wellbeing, are all equally needed to achieve balance in life. We are pleased to offer a robust rewards package that help our employees have peace of mind in and outside of work. Our benefit offerings address all of the areas that are part of living a healthy life.


We recognize that what is important to people, continues to change. Some of our other benefits to ensure our employees feel supported, include continuing to offer health and dental coverage for domestic partners and a full list below. title: IT Financials & Portfolio Manager
description:
Company:Driven Brands
We invite you to join us at Driven Brands!


Headquartered in Charlotte, NC, Driven Brands (NASDAQ: DRVN) is the largest automotive services company in North America, providing a range of consumer and commercial automotive needs, including paint, collision, glass, vehicle repair, oil change, maintenance and car wash.


With over 4,500 centers in 15 countries, Driven Brands is the parent company of some of North America’s leading automotive service brands including Take 5 Oil Change, Take 5 Car Wash, Driven Glass, Meineke, Maaco, CARSTAR, and more. Our network services over 50 million vehicles annually and generates more than $5 billion in system-wide sales each year.


Our culture inspires high performance and innovation, enabling our employees to go further, faster in their careers. With amazing people and great brands, we confidently look forward to exciting growth ahead, and believe in following the values that support this vision.


**JOB DESCRIPTION:**

**Responsibilities**

* Lead the design and implementation of IT Service Portfolio Management to optimize and align IT services with organizational goals.
* Define and maintain a comprehensive portfolio of IT services, ensuring strategic alignment and value delivery.
* Work closely with the FP&A teams to develop and manage IT budgets, providing insights and recommendations for cost optimization and efficiency improvements.
* Collaborate on forecasting processes, incorporating IT financials to ensure accurate predictions and resource allocation.
* Establish and manage processes for collecting, analyzing, and reporting actuals on IT financials.
* Monitor and analyze financial performance against budgets, identifying and addressing variances.
* Oversee invoice management processes, ensuring accuracy, timely processing, and adherence to financial policies.
* Collaborate with Accounts Payable (AP) to streamline invoice workflows.
* Build strong relationships, serve as a liaison between Finance, Accounting, and IT, fostering strong relationships and effective communication.
* Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to ensure alignment and understanding of financial and IT objectives.
* Management of IT capital, ensuring alignment with organizational goals and financial strategies.
* Help manage the full cycle of IT capital projects from idea generation, demand assessment, approval, and implementation.
* Participate in the Oracle Cloud ERP implementation, ensuring seamless integration with IT financial processes.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to align Oracle ERP functionalities with the organization's IT financial requirements.
* Identify opportunities for process improvements within IT financial and portfolio management.
* Implement best practices to enhance efficiency, accuracy, and transparency in financial processes.

**Qualifications & Experience**

* Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Accounting or Finance
* 5-10+ years of experience with increasing responsibility in an IT or business related financial role
* Proven experience in IT financial management, portfolio management, and working with FP&A teams
* Strong understanding of IT Service Portfolio Management concepts and methodologies.
* Experience with Oracle Cloud ERP or similar ERP systems.
* Ability to drive and implement process improvements
* Experience in leveraging technology to improve finance processes
* Process-oriented with the ability to structure processes
* Ability to gather, structure and analyze data from multiple data sources
* Ability to play both a strategic and tactical role as a leader and demonstrate an ownership mentality
* Ability to communicate/present to management
* Strong initiative-taker with a resilient, solution minded approach to complex problems
* Ability to partners with others to simplify complex processes, break down barriers and incorporate the ideas of others
* Ability to manage priorities against multiple deadlines in a challenging environment


#LI-KD1


#LI-REMOTE


DBCORP


Position Location:


North Carolina
Compensation Range:


$96,700.00 - $176,600.00
Compensation Frequency:


Annual
Base pay offered may vary depending on actual location, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. Supplemental pay types may include commissions or bonus incentives, depending on the role. Driven Brands offers a variety of health and wellness benefits including paid time off and holiday pay. Details regarding our benefits can be found here: https://www.drivenbrandsbenefits.com

title: Strategic IT Sourcing Manager
description:
It’s an exciting time to join the WellSense Health Plan, a growing regional health insurance company with a 25-year history of providing health insurance that works for our members, no matter their circumstances.


**Job Summary:**



The Strategic IT Sourcing Manager is responsible for the delivery of best in class strategic sourcing, contract management and negotiation. Develop strategies for complex, indirect spend IT category and serve as the primary contact for business customers. Drive effective, fact-based group decisions that have significant operational or financial impact. Build and manage relationships with internal customers, contribute to savings opportunities, ensure regulatory compliance, and mitigate company risk. The ideal candidate will be a self-starter, and thrive in rapidly changing, delivery-focused environments.

Our Investment in You:


* Full-time remote work


* Competitive salaries


* Excellent benefits


**Key Functions/Responsibilities:**


* Develop sustainable strategies for IT Category that include spend analysis, market and geographic considerations, and strategic importance, etc.
* Identify and qualify large-scale / executive level IT suppliers to perform critical services, develop relevant specifications and Statement of Work/Services language, conduct supplier sourcing events.
* Responsible for large-scale third party relationships with direct responsibility for commercial, contractual, legal and financial aspects including striving for most favorable total cost of ownership (price and service delivery/quality) from the supplier arrangements.
* Negotiate and manage complex contracts IT category ensuring the relentless pursuit of cost savings and favorable terms.
* Develop focus area knowledge and expertise to further understand company-wide IT needs and evaluate suppliers within focus area.


* Apply in-depth knowledge to solve broad issues that are complex in scope, and establish medium to long- range plans.
* Recommend and implement sourcing and contracting policies and procedures that provide for financial strength of the company and asset security.
* Drive continuous improvement in all aspects of the procurement process including the evaluation of existing contracts for savings opportunities.


* Develop sustainable sourcing strategies for assigned spend categories by considering spend profiles, market and geographic considerations, WellSense’s strategic objectives, etc.
* Maintain contracting and compliance data integrity within the contract management systems.


* Lead business owners through the supplier selection, procurement, and contracting process to ensure that contracts produce value in alignment with WellSense’s objectives.


* Partner with Supplier Relationship Managers and Operations Managers as needed to resolve supplier issues.


**Supervision Exercised:**


* None


**Supervision Received:**


* General direction received weekly


**Qualifications:**


**E****duc****a****tio****n****:**
----------------------------------


* Bachelor’s degree required


**Pr****efe****r****r****ed/D****e****si****r****able:**
--------------------------------------------------------


* Master’s degree in a related field preferred.


**E****xp****e****r****ien****c****e:**
---------------------------------------


* The Strategic IT Sourcing Manager would have a Bachelor’s degree in business, supply chain management, or related field and 5 + years IT sourcing and contracting experience or related field. MBA or similar degree preferred.


* Healthcare related experience preferred
* Working knowledge of regulatory requirements in a healthcare environment (FDRs, CMS, NCQA, URAC, etc.) preferred
* Experience in CMS Medicare products, Medicaid, or both preferred

  




**Ce****r****tific****a****tion****o****r****Conditio****n****s****of****E****m****p****l****o****y****m****en****t****:**
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


* Pre-employment background check


**Competencies, Skills, and Attributes:**
-----------------------------------------


* Advanced leadership and change management skills


* Advanced, demonstrated ability to lead highly complex sourcing events


* Advanced skillset in driving decisions and influencing stakeholders in multi-functional corporate areas


* Demonstrated mature approach to problem solving and conflict resolution


* In depth knowledge of sourcing and contract fundamentals.
* Demonstrated knowledge of IT spend category, contracting skills and principles, laws, regulations, and industry standards.


* Prior experience in all elements of sourcing and category management for IT services.
* Strong Project management skills with the ability to lead and prioritize activities.


* Proven negotiation skills and the ability to apply key sourcing principles.


* Effective communication and collaboration skills with a wide variety of stakeholders, including leadership and large groups.
* Demonstrated competency in facilitating, leading and influencing decision-making.


* Excellent problem solving and risk management skills.


* Ability to accomplish results through others by establishing relationships, effective controls and monitoring processes.


* Ability to develop and analyze business cases, spend analytics, and financial models.


* Ability to translate data into convincing information.


* Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Office products.


**Working Conditions and Physical Effort:**


* Limited travel may be required


**About WellSense**



WellSense Health Plan is a nonprofit health insurance company serving more than 740,000 members across Massachusetts and New Hampshire through Medicare, Individual and Family, and Medicaid plans. Founded in 1997, WellSense provides high-quality health plans and services that work for our members, no matter their circumstances.

title: Director, IT Operations Warehouse/Pharmacy
description:
Hims & Hers Health, Inc. (better known as Hims & Hers) is the leading health and wellness platform, on a mission to help the world feel great through the power of better health. We are revolutionizing telehealth for providers and their patients alike. Making personalized solutions accessible is of paramount importance to Hims & Hers and we are focused on continued innovation in this space. Hims & Hers offers nonprescription products and access to highly personalized prescription solutions for a variety of conditions related to mental health, sexual health, hair care, skincare, heart health, and more.



Hims & Hers is a public company, traded on the NYSE under the ticker symbol "HIMS". To learn more about the brand and offerings, you can visit hims.com and forhers.com, or visit our investor site. For information on the company's outstanding benefits, culture, and its talent-first flexible/remote work approach, see below and visit www.hims.com/careers-professionals.

### **About the Role:**



Exciting opportunity to be part of the Technology Operations leadership team!



We are looking for a Director to lead our IT field operations across implementations and support of all infrastructure systems including security systems (firewall), routers, switches, access points, servers, workstations, printers, and RF devices for warehouses/pharmacies. This role is onsite based in Columbus, OH, or Gilbert, AZ, and requires travel between sites as needed, with future opportunities for hybrid work arrangement.


### **You Will:**


* The #1 priority of this position is to ensure the systems supporting the warehouse/pharmacy are always up and running in both Columbus, OH and Gilbert, AZ
* Maintain infrastructure services covering all network devices (firewall, routers, switches, access points, servers, workstations, RFs, and printers), operating systems, and applications uptime running on the physical and virtual server infrastructure - ensuring stability and up to date operating systems and patches
* Lead a team supporting IT field operations by establishing continuous service improvement targets and individual team metrics, to help develop team members and overall team performance
* Ensure proactive monitoring, performance tuning, security administration, capacity planning, and disaster recovery (server backups) of all applicable hardware, and systems
* Ensure users are provided with efficient, effective, and timely support on a 24x7 basis; manage staff schedules to ensure optimal coverage and responsiveness between multiple sites
* Joint ownership of warehouse/pharmacy COTS systems with a focus on technical aspects including relationship management of the system integrators
* Experience with vendor performance management - development and monitoring of SOWs and deliverables, SLA compliance, and general vendor relationship management
* Oversee incident management and root-cause identification exercises to identify and correct major problems in collaboration with SRE and Business Operations teams
* End-to-end planning, management, and delivery of operational and technology projects related to the warehousing/pharmacy environment
* Communicate regularly with staff through group meetings and individual sessions; ensure issues/input from the team are listened to and that organization/department strategy, goals, and decisions are communicated consistently and on time
* Assist with developing and enforcing IT procedures, standards, and best practices in collaboration with Corporate IT and Security
* Provide IT license forecasting, contract negotiations, technology refresh, and budget
* Perform additional duties as assigned

### **You Have:**


* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or relevant work experience
* 12+ years of experience in a Technology related role
* 5 + years experience supporting Warehouse Management Systems (WMS) and/or Pharmacies
* Background in Retail or Healthcare industry preferred
* Expert in proposing, implementing, and configuring solutions to complex business-critical problems
* Experience operating successfully within a high-growth and fast-paced environment
* Experience with user-centric customer support
* Strong technical knowledge of Windows (Mac OS nice to have)
* 5 + years with network design, configuring, and managing WAN / LAN layer 2 and 3 site-to-site VPN, QoS, DNS, TCP/IP protocols, and IPv6.
* 5 + years experience with virtualization, VMWare
* Familiarity with Cisco Meraki (security appliance, managed switches, wireless access points, and cameras)
* Familiarity and working knowledge of SD-WAN, ZTNA, and Perimeter Security
* Experience with SOX and HIPAA preferred
* Experience with Hybrid Cloud environment preferred (Public or Private Cloud)
* Excellent communication skills both verbal and written
* Strong creative and analytical thinking with a high attention to detail
* Self-directed and capable of taking initiative

### **Our Benefits (there are more but here are some highlights):**


* Competitive salary & equity compensation for full-time roles
* Unlimited PTO, company holidays, and quarterly mental health days
* Comprehensive health benefits including medical, dental & vision, and parental leave
* Employee Stock Purchase Program (ESPP)
* Employee discounts on hims & hers & Apostrophe online products
* 401k benefits with employer matching contribution
* Offsite team retreats

  


*#LI-Remote*

  

Outlined below is a reasonable estimate of H&H's compensation range for this role.  

  

H&H also offers a comprehensive Total Rewards package that includes equity grants of restricted stock (RSU's) so that H&H employees own a piece of our company.  

  

The actual amount will take into account a range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions including but not limited to, skill sets, experience and training, licensure and certifications, and location.  

  

Consult with your Recruiter during any potential screening to determine a more targeted range based on the job-related factors. We don't ever want the pay range to act as a deterrent from you applying!**An estimate of the current salary range for US-based employees is**


$180,000—$205,000 USD
We are focused on building a diverse and inclusive workforce. If you're excited about this role, but do not meet 100% of the qualifications listed above, we encourage you to apply.

Hims considers all qualified applicants in accordance with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

title: Senior Manager, Strategic Sourcing & Procurement – IT/Telecom
description:
Are you a procurement professional seeking a new opportunity in a dynamic company? We may just have the opportunity! We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Senior Manager, Strategic Sourcing & Procurement , specializing in IT and Telecom. In this role, you will craft and implement our IT and Telecom sourcing strategy, ensuring cost-effectiveness, efficiency, and reliability in the procurement of IT and Telecom goods and services. If you are a strategic problem solver with skills in sourcing and negotiation, we invite you to join Fortive and contribute to the success of our forward-thinking organization.
  
  

**Essential duties and responsibilities:**  

Establishing and administering Key Performance Indicators to measure results and drive success, including monthly reporting of those measurements.
  
Collecting and analyzing spend data to drive compliance and act upon rogue purchases.
  
Collaborate with suppliers and internal business owners to ensure established metrics are achieved and countermeasures are implemented when needed.
  
Drive suppliers to understand and align with the Fortive culture, organizational framework, and expectations for continuous improvement.
  
Facilitating dialogue between leadership teams to formulate and implement strategies that align Fortive and operating company business objectives, sourcing decisions, and cost-saving initiatives.
  
Lead negotiations with suppliers to secure favorable terms and agreements, optimizing costs without compromising quality or service levels.
  
Monitor market trends, supplier performance, and industry benchmarks to highlight opportunities for improvement.
  
Build and maintain strong relationships with key suppliers, fostering mutually beneficial partnerships.
  
Evaluate and address risk factors related to sourcing activities, ensuring compliance with company policies and industry regulations.
  
Drive initiatives to enhance overall procurement processes, efficiency, and effectiveness.
  
  

The best candidate for this role will have skills to lead sourcing projects in diverse environments and delivering solutions on time and within budgets. They will learn quickly as the industry grows and changes, understanding business drivers and the impacts of innovation.
  
  

This role requires prior managerial and technical experience in the following areas:
  
  

At least 3 - 5 years of strategic sourcing experience preferably within IT/Telecom.
  
Knowledge and understanding of procurement processes.
  
Strong technical knowledge of current IT hardware, services, and standards.
  
Project management expertise.
  
Strong leadership skills.
  
Excellent written and oral English communication skills.
  
Excellent interpersonal capabilities.
  
Ability to present ideas in business-friendly and user-friendly language.
  
Highly self-motivated and self-directed.
  
Keen attention to detail.
  
Analytical, evaluative, and problem-solving abilities.
  
Ability to effectively prioritize and complete tasks in a high-pressure environment.
  
Exceptional customer service orientation.
  
Extensive experience working in a team-oriented environment.
  
Ability to negotiate purposefully and ethically.
  
Experience structuring contracts and managing business relationships.
  
Willingness and ability to travel domestically and internationally.
  
Ability to influence executive leadership.
  
  

The best candidates will have strong project management skills and should have:
  
  

Abilities to develop and maintain project plans including schedules, project requirements, budgets and delivery.
  
Deep understanding of IT-relevant industry standards and market trends including strategic issues that may impact how large corporations acquire and implement IT services and products.
  
Experience being responsible for 3rd party technology partners and vendor relationships.
  
Strong written and verbal communication skills at multiple levels. Ability to thoughtfully present to and influence audiences at all levels.
  
  

Fortive Corporation Overview
  
  

Fortive’s essential technology makes the world stronger, safer, and smarter. We accelerate transformation across a broad range of applications including environmental, health and safety compliance, industrial condition monitoring, next-generation product design, and healthcare safety solutions.
  
  

We are a global industrial technology innovator with a startup spirit. Our forward-looking companies lead the way in software-powered workflow solutions, data-driven intelligence, AI-powered automation, and other disruptive technologies. We’re a force for progress, working alongside our customers and partners to solve challenges on a global scale, from workplace safety in the most demanding conditions to groundbreaking sustainability solutions.
  
  

We are a diverse team 18,000 strong, united by a dynamic, inclusive culture and energized by limitless learning and growth. We use the proven Fortive Business System (FBS) to accelerate our positive impact.
  
  

At Fortive, we believe in you. We believe in your potential—your ability to learn, grow, and make a difference.
  
  

At Fortive, we believe in us. We believe in the power of people working together to solve problems no one could solve alone.
  
  

At Fortive, we believe in growth. We’re honest about what’s working and what isn’t, and we never stop improving and innovating.
  
  

**Fortive:** For you, for us, for growth.
  
  

Ready to move your career forward? Find out more at careers.fortive.com .
  
Fortive Corporation Overview
  
  

Fortive’s essential technology makes the world stronger, safer, and smarter. We accelerate transformation across a broad range of applications including environmental, health and safety compliance, industrial condition monitoring, next-generation product design, and healthcare safety solutions.
  
  

We are a global industrial technology innovator with a startup spirit. Our forward-looking companies lead the way in software-powered workflow solutions, data-driven intelligence, AI-powered automation, and other disruptive technologies. We’re a force for progress, working alongside our customers and partners to solve challenges on a global scale, from workplace safety in the most demanding conditions to groundbreaking sustainability solutions.
  
We Are an Equal Opportunity Employer
  
Fortive Corporation and all Fortive Companies are proud to be equal opportunity employers. We value and encourage diversity and solicit applications from all qualified applicants without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, age, marital status, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or other characteristics protected by law. Fortive and all Fortive Companies are also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for applicants with disabilities. Individuals who need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process should ask to speak with a Human Resources representative to request an accommodation.
  
  

**National:** The salary range for this position is $109500 - $203500
  
  

This position is also eligible for bonus as part of the total compensation package.
  
  

Base pay offered may vary depending on various factors, including, but not limited to: job-related knowledge; skills; experience; and other eligibility factors such as geographic location. The Total Rewards package includes competitive base pay and an opportunity to enroll in a variety of benefit programs, generally including health insurance, flexible spending accounts, health savings accounts, retirement savings plans, life and disability insurance programs, and several programs that provide for both paid and unpaid time away from work.

title: Category Leader, IT
description:
*Work Mode: Remote*

**Location:** Hybrid at Kohler, WI

**Opportunity**

  

Responsible for financial and operational performance within specified areas of the IT category. Responsible for negotiating XaaS, telecom, equipment, and/or services agreements globally, at a corporate level, for all business units. Accountable for supplier selection decisions within category and projects. Prepares and evaluates supplier quotations and services to determine the most competitive solution based upon total cost of ownership. Familiar with a variety of purchasing concepts, practices, and procedures.


**Specific Responsibilities**

* Lead the development of Category Strategy
* Deliver on risk reduction goals and increases to service levels
* Support the management of existing vendor relationships and performance
* Evaluate and support the additions of new vendors and technology as needed
* Identify, plan, and execute projects and initiatives focused on delivering cost reduction
* Proactively identify future areas of opportunity to address cost, building a pipeline of value to be executed through a variety of professional sourcing approaches
* Manage and defend against unforeseen cost increases using various negotiation tactics to minimize unfavorable impacts to Kohler
* Support strategic project execution
* Cross-functional RFx development, roll-out, and evaluation; including supplier selection, proposal analysis, and negotiation
* Identify contractual needs and establish agreements that accommodate

**Skills/Requirements**

* Bachelor’s Degree in Supply Chain, Operations, Business or Engineering
* Minimum 10 years of professional experience and 7 years of IT purchasing experience
* Experience independently managing contracts and projects >$1M in annual spend
* Experience utilizing supplier management platforms (Jaggaer a plus)

title: Director of IT, Enterprise Solutions
description:
Job Summary::

We are looking for an experienced **IT Director** to oversee the IT operations within Diné Development Corporation (DDC). This role will be responsible for overseeing employees, collaborating with other departments to understand technical requirements, and developing solutions that are aligned with DDCs objectives. The IT Director must have stellar technical aptitude, as well as superior project and people management skills. This highly visible position will maintain streamlined, secure, and updated technical operations within DDC.
Job Duties and Responsibilities: :
**Strategic Leadership:**

+ Develop and execute a comprehensive IT strategy aligning with business objectives.
+ Provide strategic direction for the design, development, and deployment of enterprise solutions.

**ServiceNow Expertise:**

+ Leverage expertise in ServiceNow to streamline and optimize IT service management processes.
+ Oversee the customization, configuration, and integration of ServiceNow to meet organizational requirements.

**API Integration:**

+ Lead API integration initiatives to ensure seamless connectivity between various systems.
+ Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and implement robust API solutions.

**System Integration and Migration:**

+ Demonstrate knowledge and experience in the integration and migration of systems for enhanced efficiency and performance.
+ Develop strategies for seamless transition and consolidation of IT systems.

**Vendor Management:**

+ Manage relationships with technology vendors, ensuring the effective procurement and utilization of enterprise solutions.
+ Evaluate and select vendors that align with the organization's technology roadmap.

**System Experience:**

+ Possess experience with Jamis, Humanic, HRIS systems, and Zendesk.
+ Act as a subject matter expert for these systems, providing guidance on optimization, integration, and migration.

**Team Leadership:**

+ Lead and mentor a team of IT professionals, fostering a collaborative and innovative work environment.
+ Provide guidance on professional development and skills enhancement.

**Project Management:**

+ Manage project initiatives to be delivered on time, on budget and within the staffing plan.
+ Collaborate with stakeholders to define project scope, goals, and deliverables.

**Security and Compliance:**

+ Implement and maintain robust security measures for enterprise solutions.
+ Ensure compliance with industry standards and regulations.


Job Requirements (Education/Skills/Experience)::
**Qualifications:**  

* Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or related field; Master's degree preferred.
* Proven experience (8+ years) in a leadership role within IT, with a focus on enterprise solutions.
* ITIL Foundations Certification
* Active Secret Security Clearance or ability to obtain one
* Knowledge and experience working in government contracting
* Extensive experience with ServiceNow and API integration is a must.
* Knowledge and experience in the integration and migration of systems.
* Familiarity with Jamis, Humanic, HRIS systems, and Zendesk is a plus.
* Strong strategic thinking and problem-solving skills.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Demonstrated ability to manage and lead a high-performing IT team.

**Competencies:*** **Leadership:** As head of an IT department, you will be responsible for setting the tone and direction for the team. You must be able to motivate and encourage your team members to do their best work, and handle conflict and difficult situations.
* **Time Management:** Proficiency in prioritizing tasks, meet deadlines, and avoid multi-tasking.
* **Communication Skills:** The ability to communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical staff and stakeholders and be able to listen and understand the needs of the team.
* **Change Management:** Demonstrated ability to plan, implement and monitor changes within and to an organization.
* **Accountability and Commitment:** Willingness to take ownership of tasks and ensure follow-through on all commitments.
* **Strategic Thinking:** Think long term, strategically and see the big picture in order to make decisions that will benefit the company as a whole.
* **Business Acumen:** A sound understanding of business principles, including budgeting and financial analysis.
* **Integrity and Values:** Consistently acting with integrity and upholding the core values of the organization.
* **Problem Solving:** Ability to problem solve and make decisions quickly and effectively.
